content.html:
SCREEN SETTING

AUTOROTATE PB


Choose ON to automatically rotate "tall" (portrait-orientation)
pictures during playback.


Options
ONOFF
FOCUS SCALE UNITS
Choose the units used for the focus distance indicator.

Options
METERSFEET

Choose whether the camera displays aperture as a T-number
(used for movie camera lenses) or an f/-number (used for still
camera lenses) when an optional FUJINON MKX-series lens is
attached. For information on using cinema lenses, see the docu-
mentation provided with the lens.


OptionDescription
T NUMBERA measure of lens aperture commonly used by cinematogra- phers. Lens transmittance is taken into account to better cal- culate exposure.
F NUMBERA measure oflens aperture commonly used by photographers. Lens transmittance is assumed to be 100%, meaning that the same aperture may produce different exposures depending on the lens.
APERTURE UNIT FOR CINEMA LENS

content.markdown:
SCREEN SETTING

# AUTOROTATE PB

# Choose ON to automatically rotate "tall" (portrait-orientation)
pictures during playback.

| Options | Options |
| --- | --- |
| ON | OFF |
| FOCUS SCALE UNITS |  |
| Choose the units used for the focus distance indicator. | Choose the units used for the focus distance indicator. |


| Options | Options |
| --- | --- |
| METERS | FEET |


APERTURE UNIT FOR CINEMA LENS

Choose whether the camera displays aperture as a T-number
(used for movie camera lenses) or an f/-number (used for still
camera lenses) when an optional FUJINON MKX-series lens is
attached. For information on using cinema lenses, see the docu-
mentation provided with the lens.

| Option | Description |
| --- | --- |
| T NUMBER | A measure of lens aperture commonly used by cinematogra- phers. Lens transmittance is taken into account to better cal- culate exposure. |
| F NUMBER | A measure oflens aperture commonly used by photographers. Lens transmittance is assumed to be 100%, meaning that the same aperture may produce different exposures depending on the lens. |

content.html: APERTURE UNIT FOR CINEMA LENS

Choose whether the camera displays aperture as a T-number
(used for movie camera lenses) or an f/-number (used for still
camera lenses) when an optional FUJINON MKX-series lens is
attached. For information on using cinema lenses, see the docu-
mentation provided with the lens.
content.markdown:
Choose whether the camera displays aperture as a T-number
(used for movie camera lenses) or an f/-number (used for still
camera lenses) when an optional FUJINON MKX-series lens is
attached. For information on using cinema lenses, see the docu-
mentation provided with the lens.

content.html:
OptionDescription
T NUMBERA measure of lens aperture commonly used by cinematogra- phers. Lens transmittance is taken into account to better cal- culate exposure.
F NUMBERA measure oflens aperture commonly used by photographers. Lens transmittance is assumed to be 100%, meaning that the same aperture may produce different exposures depending on the lens.
